Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2007 12:48PM LottaQuilts wrote: Just finished my last chemo yesterday and have my mapping session on 12/27.... so I'm jumping on too.  Jane and I are buddies from the chemo in July thread, but I'll be nice to get to know the rest of you as well. I'm in for 6 weeks plus a couple "boosters"..... I forget how many.  That was way back in June and I've been chemo-brained since! Got myself some Sween Cream as I noticed a lot of girls recommending it.  At any rate, let's cheer each other on through this next adventure! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2008 09:21AM LottaQuilts wrote: Getting my tatoos on Monday.  A little nervous, but after chemo, how bad can it be, really? Port comes out on Wednesday, and yes, I get to be put under for it.  I know some Drs. just do it in their offices with local numbing.  Mine says she prefers the sterile environment of the OR and having her patients "calm" (i.e. snoozin')... I for one am glad to have it this way as well.  I'm a very tense person anyway and I'd be a basket case if I had to be awake for the procedure! Not sure when I'll start actual treatments.  Perhaps Thursday.  I'm anxious to get started.  I always get nervous about the "unknown"... I'm sure once I get going it'll be fine.   Plus, other than the Tamoxifin, this is the end of treatment for me.... can't wait for that! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2008 01:07PM LottaQuilts wrote: Methusala - did you rescue the Zinfandel?  Teenagers sure can get you, can't they.  My DS is 16 and is the nicest guy going.  That being said, he's also the laziest guy going.  We fight over grades constantly.  He just started yesterday at Sylvan Learning Center in my last ditch effort to get the grades up (all Cs and Ds at this point).  And this is a kid with a 135 IQ!!  Makes you just want to beat the crap out of them, doesn't it? I had my mapping yesterday which was just fine.  Hardest part was lying still with the arms over the head for a good 1/2 hour while they kept adjusting this and that.  No tatoos yet.  Probably on Thursday when I go for my first official "zapping".  They want to do some more X-rays then and a final lining up of everything before they permanently mark me. So now I have new and different Sharpie marks.  What fun! Tomorrow my port is coming out - Wahoo!!!!  I'm sure it won't be too comfortable on Thursday to be lying in position with a new incision on my chest, but I figure I can handle it for the 10 minutes or so I'll be there. But I must say.  I thought my chemo nurses were nice.  These folks are even nicer, if that's possible.  I have on female tech and one male and he makes you feel real comfortable.... I don't mind that I'm exposing myself to him at all.  Very professional and respectful. So the real thing starts on Thursday.  How many are you all doing?  I have 25 and then 5 boosters..... so I'm counting down from 30 until DONE!!! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2008 08:39AM LottaQuilts wrote: (((Donna))).  You poor thing, you.... you sound miserable.  Just hang in there, girl.  You're almost at the finish line.   Then you can concentrate on healing! Regarding the vitamin E, maybe it's not a problem since it's topical.  I guess all we can do is trust that our doctors give us good advice.  It is frustrating that they all seem to have different opinions, though.  Just goes to show you how much the medical community DOESN'T know about cancer. Freezing rain here in Pittsburgh today.  Kids had a 2 hour delay, but I don't think it's gotten any better.  I'm going to try to get out of my driveway and drive them to the bus stop..... there's no way they can walk down the sidewalks.... just a sheet of ice! Hope everyone else is having better weather today! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2008 09:22AM LottaQuilts wrote: I recently started working out at a gym as well.  I joined with my DS (16) who has some self-esteem issues.  The gym was suggested as a way to boost his self-image.  He needed somebody to go with and I figured I needed to start to get my health back. We've been 4 times so far and, while I am definately a wimp, I am seeing improvement already (for both him and me).  Those wimpy little 10 lb weights I could barely work 10 times I'm starting to be able to list almost with ease. I worked with a trainer my first two sessions and he knows my situation.  He was really impressed that I was motivated to start before my treatments are even done. So when you feel "decrepid" (like I do sometimes) watching all the people who are in better shape than you are (like all of them) remember that you are probably the ONLY cancer patient in the place.  Just being there is an accomplishment after what we've been through!! Paxton - good luck with the car situation.  Cars can really be a pain in the butt sometimes..... and who needs more stress, really.... Hang in there gang.... we're almost to the finish line! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2008 01:18PM LottaQuilts wrote: They were asking me about fatigue at my last visit with the rad onc.  I honestly cannot say I'm any more fatigued now than I've been the last few months.  It's been a long year.... I can't remember the last time I WASN'T tired!  Actually, I've been pretty energized lately because the end is soooo close. I survivor-friend said one day, about a year after treatments she woke up and wondered what was wrong with her.... then she realized it was that she felt GOOD.   It's that way with me.... tired has just been a way of life so long I don't remember what it's like to not be tired! I was happily surprised to get back into my "skinny" jeans this week.  Still a couple pounds to lose to get back to where I was pre-cancer, but I'm looking good, if I do say so myself.  Now if those blasted eyebrows would just grow a little faster..... 8 more treatments for me.  3 reg, 5 boosts.  Had my CT scan for the boost yesterday which really made it seem real that I am almost at the finish line. Have a great day everybody....keep those boobies greased up! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2008 12:55PM LottaQuilts wrote: (((Nash))).  So sorry to hear about your mom.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2008 06:36AM LottaQuilts wrote: Hi... I'm here.  Just been busy since coming back from vacation. We had a great time.  It was so nice to see leaves and flowers and SUNSHINE.  Well, I know the chemo didn't put me in menopause because I just had my first period since Aug.  Drat!  I was kinda hoping I was done with that.  Looking on the bright side, I'm taking it as a sign that my body is healing and that it's probably best for my bones and heart if I'm not in menopause at 45..... Been looking for a job and I have my first interview set up for Friday afternoon.  The job sounds really great and is only like 10 minutes from my house.  Wish me luck! I missed the hot-flash/Tamoxifin discussion.  I'm lucky in that I've been taking Tamox going on 3 months here and have yet to have any side effects.  I asked my onc. if that meant I wasn't metabolizing it.  She says no.... it just means I'm not getting any SEs.  So I consider myself lucky there. So right now I have not too many lasting problems from my BC ordeal.  My scars are small, my hair is coming in nicely (I believe I look "normal" at this point)... I just have some tenderness still in my radiated breast which I assume is normal.  Looks like I survived! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2007 08:52AM - edited Oct 9, 2007 08:52AM by LottaQuilts I've done 4 A/C and 3 of my 12 Taxol.  My hair on my head started falling out 2 weeks after my first A/C.  We buzzed it and it continued to fall out, but I was left with a few bits of stubble - never completely smooth.  I figured that was good..... helped give the scarves something to cling to. I've lost most of the hair "down there", but again, there's a little hanging in.  I too have to shave my legs every couple weeks or so.  I have very little left in the way of eyebrows/lashes, but enough to see where to fill in the eyebrows and enough that I can get a little mascara on the lashes. I have noticed the last week or so that the stubble on my head is starting to get longer (gee, I good 1/8 of an inch or so!) and there are some new hairs sprouting up.  My onc. said it would start growing in on weekly Taxol, so maybe he was right. I have to get my driver's license renewed in mid March, so I'm hoping to have enough hair by then to be topless.  I don't wear a wig, just scarves, so I'm not sure what I'd do about my license pic if I'm still bald.... do you suppose they give you an extention?  Oh well, no sense worrying about that until March, huh?
Posts.Title: Did you lose all of your hair on chemo? liven42day Jodian72

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2007 09:58AM LottaQuilts wrote: I'm so happy for you, Harley.   I feel I've gotten to know you from our insomnia conversations. I've still got a l-o-n-g way to go, but you make me feel like I'm gonna make it! Abbi
Posts.Title: A toast to Harley geebung Harley44

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2007 03:03PM LottaQuilts wrote: Just got back from my first mapping session, so I'm marked with Sharpie!  Real easy, no problems.  Gotta wait about a week until they get stuff back from their computer and then get the tatoos. My port comes out on the 9th and we'll probably start the actual treatments on the 10th..... the end of the road is near. I'm hoping to be done in time to go to Florida on March 14 for a vacation, but it looks like I'll be done in plenty of time for that. Off to take DD shopping today.... wish me luck! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2008 01:06PM LottaQuilts wrote: I'm still waiting on my tatoos.  They told me about a week.... it's a week today, but I figure with the holidays they're behind schedule.  Getting my port out on Wednesday (if I can get rid of the cold I picked up over the weekend) and I can't wait for THAT.  I was glad to have my port for chemo, but I'll be real glad to be rid of it as well. But I'm ready to get going (and thereby get DONE) with this radiation thing.  Guess nobody else is in a hurry but me. Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2008 07:55AM LottaQuilts wrote: Jane - my port site is healing just fine.  My rads onc wanted 3 weeks between chemo/rads as well, so that gave me time to get it out.  I had it out last Wednesday and started rads on Thursday with no problems at all. Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2008 04:45PM LottaQuilts wrote: It's official!!  I'm freakin' done!!! OMG.... this feels soooo good. I managed to hold it together in the onc. office..... got in my car and sobbed!!! Now I'm ready to get on with the rest of my life..... Wahoo!! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2008 03:57PM LottaQuilts wrote: Feel better, Barbie. I got cancelled today (bummer)... a transformer blew near my rads place and their power was out.  Guess they can't zap you w/o electricity!  I still feel nothing in the way of SEs, but then again, I've only been zapped 4 times so far.  How long did it take before you started getting pink/feeling fatigue? Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2008 03:35PM LottaQuilts wrote: Hope you're feeling better, ChemoMom..... it's always something, isn't it? Skibi... you'll make it through just fine.  How many treatments are you doing.  I'm doing 30.  6 done so far.  I've just started and I'm already 1/5 of the way done!  So far, the only SE I'm noticing is that my nipple is a little tender.  I'm militant about my lotions.  Sween cream in the a.m. after my shower and after rads (2:00 pm) and then greasy Aquaphor at bedtime.  So far, so good. No rads tomorrow.... they're closed for the MLK holiday (bummer), so I'll only get 4 in this week.   But then by next week I'll have 10 done - 1/3 of the way done!!!!  See how those numbers just go by sooo fast.  This will all be over before we know it.  We can do it!!! Popcorn at the center?  What fun! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2008 01:05PM LottaQuilts wrote: Grrrr.... the machine is down today.  No zapping for me. I hate when that happens! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 09:00AM LottaQuilts wrote: I've had #11/30 and I'm just starting to pink up.  I'm especially sensitive at the scar area of my sentinal node incision.  My rad onc suggested vitamin E oil.  Just take the little capsules, break 'em open and apply.  So I'm going to try that.  I've been using Sween cream during the day and Aquaphor at night. Fatigue is starting to set in for me as well.  But this still sure beats the hell out of chemo. We're going to make it gals.... hang tough!!! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2008 11:04AM LottaQuilts wrote: Wahoo, Donna!!!  I have 10 more to go.  So (barring any unforseen circumstances) I'll be done 2 weeks from now. I'm getting really itchy and red.  Going bra-less as much as possible.  Luckily, I'm an at-home mom at the moment, so no one cares!  But I am getting really tired of the baggy sweatshirt look. I'm sure I'll cry when I'm finished 'cause I cry just imagining that day.  I'm a very emotional person.  I sobbed both the first and last day of chemo... though I laughed about it the last time! I was planning on baking some cookies or brownies or something to take to the office staff on my last day. Actually, I've become very close to the lady who goes after me at rads.... she's exactly my age and treating BC as well.  She'll be done on Friday and I'm really going to miss her.  Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2008 05:48PM LottaQuilts wrote: Marietta - a question for you and others who are now interviewing for jobs.... How did you handle the cancer issue?  Were you up-front about it?  I'm going to start interviewing at the end of March (we're going to Florida mid-March.... Yippee!!).  I obviously look a little "odd"... my hair is still pretty short to look like I did it on purpose. I want to be honest with a potential employer, but in the same respect, I don't want to ruin my chances because an employer may be worried about time I'll miss for appointments, tests, etc... KWIM? Just curious how you handled it. Paxton - you and I have exactly the same schedule left.  I'm fairly burned, but not too bad.  I'm very generous with the burn cream she prescribed and my moisturizers.  I'm hoping that since the boosts are so targeted, my really sensitive areas (nipple and underneath the breast) will get to start healing after the last 2 zaps. No cracking or peeling of my skin (yet), just really red and itchy!  Nothing like an itchy nipple, ya know?! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2008 06:05PM LottaQuilts wrote: I'm sooo jealous of all of you finishing! I start my boosters today (5).  My tech told me that the burns may actually get worse before they get better.  He says the effects of the radiation stay with you about a month after treatments. I've been very generous with the Silvadine (sp?) cream the last couple of days, however and it really seems to be helping.  I'm with you though, Paxton.  I just wanna be DONE!!!  Hope they ok you to finish up soon. Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2008 02:55PM LottaQuilts wrote: 3 more boosts and I can join you at the finish line.  I'm surprised how fast I'm healing up already.  I only have one little sore spot - my SNB scar.  My nipple is really itchy, but my skin is starting to look less "lobster" and more "pink".... I think that's a good thing. Tired..... tired....soooooo tired.  No one can quite understand the fatigue unless they've experienced it.  DH doesn't understand how I can wake up exhausted after a good 7-8 hours of sleep.  They just don't get it. We had an exciting night last night.  DS (16) wakes me up at 11:30 pm to inform me that the kid's bathroom is flooded.  Sure enough, there's a couple inches of water on the floor, out into the hall carpet and it is "raining" through my kitchen ceiling below! So we clean up, mop up, try to find the problem (no luck) so DH shuts off the water and decides we'll just call a plumber this morning.... So this morning as we're getting ready to call the plumber DD (13) confesses that she overflowed the bathroom sink last night but didn't want to tell anyone because she was afraid she'd get yelled at!!! So today I'm calling around looking for someone who does drywall repair.  I'm probably going to have to replace a good portion of my kitchen ceiling.  Kids!!!! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2008 07:59PM LottaQuilts wrote: One more to go!!!  Wahoo!!! I was surprised to learn that I have to go back once a week for a couple months for a skin check.... hmmmm...  Oh well, beats the heck out of every day. They even moved my appointment up a little for tomorrow.  Think of my at 11:30 EST! Abbi My kid story.  When I learned to write my name, I wrote it on  everything.  Carved it into my grandmother's cherry desk, the truck of my neighbor's car......  so maybe karma is coming back to get me, huh?
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2008 12:57PM LottaQuilts wrote: So I question for you gals that have been done for a little while..... any let-up on the fatigue? My skin is healing really quickly, but I think I'm more tired than I've ever been.  It's like I'm walking around in a daze.  Now that I'm all done, there's things I want to do, places I want to go.... but just dragging out of bed in the morning is an accomplishment. Now... I know I'm only 2 days out, but the fatigue seems to be worse instead of better.  When does it start getting better? Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2008 08:00AM LottaQuilts wrote: "pre-baked goods"  - thanks for the giggle! Today (15 days out) was the first time I've gotten up in the morning and not felt exhausted.  Hoping it's the start of a trend! I see my chemo onc. tomorrow for a 3-month check up.... can it already be 3 months.... amazing. I also got my driver's license picture done yesterday.  The gal commented that I sure did change my hair style.  I explained to her that CHEMO changed my hair style.... here she's a survivor as well!!!  It never ceases to amaze me how many of us are out there... it really is an epidemic. Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2007 11:10PM LottaQuilts wrote: ..... can pronounce, spell and list the main side effects of numerous pharmaceuticals!
Posts.Title: You know you have had BC if you... trigeek bonny1963

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2008 01:18PM LottaQuilts wrote: The absolute best thing about these boards is that, no matter what's going on, you can be assurred that somebody out there understands and is going through the same thing as well. We're all SO READY to be done with this crap.  I started this journey March 15 (day before my birthday) with my gyne saying "I don't like the feel of this lump under your arm".    That anniversary is coming up soon and I'm STILL dealing with this crap.  Yesterday, no power at my rads place, so they cancelled me AGAIN.  I'm now into my 4th week and I've yet to have a 5-day week.  As good old Rosanne Rosannadanna used to say "It's always something"!  Frustrating, though.... don't they know how close I am to the finish line (13 txs)?  Grrrr..... Men.  Yes.  A little background.  In April of last year, I accepted a job and was going back to work after being home raising kids for about 10 years.  The day after I accepted the job was when my doctor called with that awful message....."the biopsy was positive".  So, I put my life on hold for awhile to battle this beast.  And believe me, I'm bored out of my mind at home and it's been a frustrating year.  Last night, DH says to me "So when do you think you'll be ready to go back to work?".  WTF!!!  Hello.... I'm STILL in treatment, I have very little hair, I look and feel like sh*t... When will I be ready to go to WORK???? Needless to say, I went a little off on him.  But he is a good man and has been my rock through all this.  But I think they're all a little clueless! Anyway, it's nice to know we are all in the same boat.  Scoop out the ice cream and pour me a Cabernet, girls! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2008 02:40PM LottaQuilts wrote: Doing the happy dance for you, Gale!!  Sounds like you had a great time with your sister as well. As far as the fear of the cancer coming back, I think that is perfectly normal.   My mom (a 22-year survivor) says that will lessen as the years go by.  She says the first couple years, every ache, paid, lump or bump you may have you think is cancer. She was telling me that, for years, her annual mammogram on her remaining breast has just been a routine.  This year, she was sitting in the waiting room and was really nervous.  Having me go through this all brought it all back to her as well. When I get those dark thoughts, I remind myself that cancer is something pretty much beyond my control.  It already got control of this past year of my life.  I refuse to let it control the rest.  I worked too hard to live to live in fear. Stay strong, girls! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2008 08:43AM LottaQuilts wrote: There it is..... its the finish line.... we're almost there...  I think Gale took first place, right?  Who's next? I have 12 more 7 regular, 5 boosts.  Assuming I get to go every day I'll be done Feb 26.  That's a big assumption, since I've yet to have a full week.... lots of power outages, breakdowns, MLK birthday.  Next Monday is President's Day.... I wonder if THAT will be a holiday too....sheesh... My skin is still hanging in really well.  I'm a little "pink", but that's about it.  The area under my breast where skin meets skin is a little sensitive.  I've been tucking a Kleenex under there and it seems to help. What's everyone using?  I use Sween Cream and Vitamin E oil during the day and Aquaphor at night.  The aquafor is soooo messy.  My nightgown has a big grease stain of the left side from it! Oh well, I've already decided that my reward to myself after I finish is all new bras.  I figure my poor breast deserves to be well taken care of in pretty stuff after the ordeal it's been through, right?  Think I'll add a nice, new pretty pj or nightie to that list as well. Keep on keepin' on, girls! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2008 06:35AM LottaQuilts wrote: (((Nash))).  Not much else I can say.  You're in my thoughts. Surprisingly, my office is NOT closed on President's Day.  Today, however, will be interesting.  The kids' schools are cancelled for the impending ice/snow we're supposed to get today.  Hopefully, they won't chose down for weather and I'll be able to get out.  Luckily, my rads center is just on the other side of my community.  Only takes me 10 minutes or so to get there. Yesterday, my Dr. gave me a new cream.  Silver Sulfadiazine.  It's a prescription burn cream.  So we'll give it a try.  My bathroom cabinet is now full of various greasy things!  With chemo, I felt "marinated", now I'm being "basted" and slowly "roasted".  Anyone else feel like a piece of meat? Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2008 01:27PM LottaQuilts wrote: "Guarded Thankfulness" is a good term for the feeling, isn't it?  Now that all the treatment is over, you feel like you should get on with your life, but we're beat and battered and not really sure WHAT to do with the rest of it, right? I feel almost like I've been given the gift of the rest of my life.  I survived and I now want to make every day count.  I feel like I should do something meaningful with my life, but what?  Right now, I'm just so darn TIRED!!  I'm battling bronchitis at the moment as well, so that doesn't help. And no.... we're always going to be cancer patients.  My mom is 23 years out from her BC now.  She says cancer is not really something she's concerned about on a daily basis, but that every time she's got something wrong and they have to run a test she worries about it coming back as cancer.  And this year, for the first time in ages, she was nervous about a mammogram .... guess I brought that all up for her again. I try to remind myself that I can't control the future.  Hopefully, I'll never have to deal with cancer again and, if I do, I'll cross that bridge when I come to it.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 12:39PM LottaQuilts wrote: Have we all made it to the finish line now? I'm 13 days out and pretty healed.  I've been wearing real bras for about a week now.  The skin is just tan, but no peeling, itching, etc.  Wahoo! Fatigue is still with me, though.  We're going to Florida on Friday for 10 days.  I'm hoping some rest, relaxation and SUNSHINE will give me some energy.  When we get back, I'm going to start job hunting... so I'll need some energy! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2008 12:22PM LottaQuilts wrote: I didn't use the Siladine during the day.  I used Sween in the a.m.... and it would pretty much be absorbed by the time I did tx (2:00).  After tx, I'd use the Sween again, and then the Silvadine at night - put it on like spackling on a wall.... really thick and understand that you are going to ruin any clothing that comes in contact with it. I was lucky that my skin never broke down, just got really red and itchy.  Good luck and HANG IN THERE.  You're going to make it and then you'll be really suprised how fast you heal.  The finish line is in site! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2008 12:44PM LottaQuilts wrote: Got my tatoos and first treatment yesterday.  Really easy!  Why was I so worried about the tatoos?  I pricked my finger worse while quilting than the little pricks for the tatoos.  And they're soooo small.  You'd have to really look closely to ever find them. Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2008 08:21PM LottaQuilts wrote: I was not awake for the port removal.  Well..... they called it "sedation" not "general anethesia".... but I sure as heck don't remember anything other than getting on the table and being wheeled into recovery! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2008 08:22PM LottaQuilts wrote: DD says I look "different" with my scarf..... I've been "commando" for a few weeks now.... guess I need a new pic! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2008 01:28PM LottaQuilts wrote: My last full breast zap is today.  Thank goodness... I was up much of the night applying creams to try to stop the itch, the burning... finally decided that bare-breasted seemed to feel the best and slept topless!!  My most bothersome areas are my SNB scar and my nipple.  Looking forward to some healing.  I'm going to Florida on 3-14 and I'd really love to be able to wear a real bra under my t-shirts (I've been going with the braless, big sweatshirt look as much as possible or a real soft sports bra) The end is near, though and it's certainly encouraging to hear that most of you are healing pretty quickly.  If all goes as planned, I should be done 1 week from today. Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2008 01:59PM LottaQuilts wrote: GG - I just howled at your story.  DD is VERY embarrassed..... as well she should be.  But, my insurance company gave me $1200 towards repairs.  Now I just have to find a company to do the repairs.  I've made several calls, but haven't found anyone yet.  I'll start trying again tomorrow. Paxton and Methusala - hang in there girls.... you CAN do it!!! I'm looking forward to Tuesday.  The champagne is already in the fridge!  I'm healing really nicely and looking forward to wearing real bras/tops again.  I actually went out to the Victoria's Secret web site yesterday and bought new bras.  I figure my poor breast has been through a lot this year - she deserves something new and pretty! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Feb 29, 2008 01:01PM LottaQuilts wrote: Wahoo, Marietta!  Feels great, doesn't it? I'm not sure how much of my exhaustion is radiation fatigue and how much is "WOW, it's all over" kinda relief tiredness. But I'm not working currently (going to start looking after we come back from Florida end March), so I can pace myself during the day.   And I sleep VERY well at night, which is a relief after the chemo insomnia problems I had last Fall. My skin is really healing quickly.  The only red area is where my boost was, the rest is just kinda tan.  I also wore a real bra yesterday... it was actually no less comfortable than the sports bras. Joni - consider yourself lucky.  I'm sure you got enough radiation... your body just took it well.  Isn't it amazing how we worry about SEs, but then if we don't have SEs we worry about THAT!!  Cancer sure messes with your mind. Have a good day, everybody!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2008 02:30PM LottaQuilts wrote: Hang in there, Methusala.... you're sprinting towards the finish line.... You go girl!!! We had a neighborhood progressive dinner last night.... you know where you go to a different home for each course?  Well, anyway, we hosted the first house for appetizers... 40 people.  Probably 30 of these people I'd never met before.  I was talking with one lady I do know well who was asking me about how I was doing.  People who didn't know I'd had cancer were shocked!  I guess my VERY short hair looks like a choice.... that makes me feel good. My hair is very curly and maybe about an inch to an inch-and-a-half.  What I really could use are bangs, though.  The back and sides look "normal", but no one would choose to cut their bangs this short! Anyway, I got a lot of "you're so braves" and "I can't believe you'd host a party 4 days out of treatment" and "you look so great"..... good for the ego!! I don't get hot flashes.  Probably means the tamoxifin isn't working, but I try not to think about THAT and just be thankful that I don't have hot flashes to deal with. Just hang in there! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2008 12:47PM LottaQuilts wrote: (((Methusala))).  You sound miserable.  Only 2 more though, baby.... you can do it!! Be generous with the cream.  I had Silvadine cream that wasn't doing too much for me until the nurse informed me that I needed to apply it like spackling... good and thick. I never had blisters or anything though.  Hope the War Zone cream works for you.  You'll be surprised how fast you start to heal once your treatments are done. Hang in there! Anyone else from this group still in treatments?  I'm hanging out here at the finish line cheering you all on and I ain't leaving 'til we ALL cross the line! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 01:11PM LottaQuilts wrote: Woo Hoo, Paxton.  Time to celebrate! I'm BRCA neg as well, though no one can tell me that with my maternal grandmom (44), mom (45) and me (44) all having BC there's not a genetic connection - they just don't know about our gene yet.  I do worry for my daughter, but hopefully she'll be very diligent about her health and find it early if she does get it. Anyway.... enjoy being DONE!!!  I feel really good, if only I wasn't so darn tired.  I suppose it takes time.... Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2008 09:09PM LottaQuilts wrote: OMG!!! Between Barbie's shoes (I'm like a mini-Imelda Marcos.. I WANT THOSE SHOES), Paxton's 80's hair and Shrink's uneven boobies.... I'm just LMAO tonight.... you guys are the BEST!!!! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2008 08:50AM LottaQuilts wrote: The interview went really well, I think.  I am the first of 4 candidates they are interviewing, so I have to wait a bit to see if I'm called back for a second.   But I really would love the job, so keep your fingers crossed for me.  My hair looks really normal and actually pretty cute.  The bangs are still a lot shorter then I would choose to wear them, but the rest is thick and curly.  I just rub a little wax around my hands and through my wet hair in the morning and I'm good to go. No hair dryer, no flat iron.... I'm NEVER going back to long hair again.    Now if the curls will just stay..... Everybody's headed to Florida it seems.   Remember your sunscreen, gals.... we've already been cooked enough! Paxton, hope your back feels better.  If it's not one thing, it's another, huh? Methusala - Financial crap does seem to come in bunches.  We had a period a couple months ago where all the cars seemed to be costing me money at the same time, and my daughter flooded the bathroom and taxes were due and......  just hang in there, things will turn around. Good weekend to all!! Abbi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: LottaQuilts wrote: I've just finished my 3rd AC (one more of those bad boys to go) and then will move on to 12 weekly Taxol txs. The OC tells me it will be much easier and I figure logically it has to be or they wouldn't give it to you once a week, right? Guess I'm looking for input from those of you who have "been there, done that" Thanks dx 3/15/07, lump. 5/15, 1.4 cm; ER+; 1 of 3 nodes+; A/Cx4; Taxol x12; 3rd gen survivor but BRCA neg (go figure) Dx 4/15/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage II, Grade 1, 1/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
